page.title: 10Leather Production Brenchley
page.content: A.Berry and Sons Ltd is one of three {Reptile Skin Dressers}in Britain,and was established in Petteridge in 1955. Skins dressed are of the Asian whipsnake and smaller watersnake,both killed for their meat.Shipments of tanned skins arrive from India, Pakistan,Bangladesh,Indonesia and Thailand. Darker skins are dyed black,lighter skins other shades,some are bleached then dyed pastel colours.Skins are ironed,sprayed with more dye and a casein gloss and stretched by hand to their full width while damp.When dry each skin is glazed using a machine to give a patent leather finish. {5 full time and 2 part time staff {process 1500_1800 skins weekly.95% of {the skins are exported,to the U.S.A, {Israel,Holland and Belgium}for bags, belts,shoes and other leather items.
